name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: (4/Q2) “You can also retroactively opt out of deferment back to March 2020. You’ll be able to have your payments paused like other borrowers, and get credit towards for the PSLF.”

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: (3/Q2) “You can still make payments on your loans while you’re in school if you’re working full time, but you have to opt into that. You have to call your loan servicer and say you don’t want to defer.”

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: (2/Q2) “For the PSLF, it’s slightly more complicated. If you left school and then returned, you can qualify for PSLF if you were working and you had older loans you were paying off.”

name: Suzanne Bonamici

name: Suzanne Bonamici

I remember the days before Roe v. Wade, when abortions done without medical care could have tragic outcomes – including death.

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: I am grateful to @SecDebHaaland for leading the effort to untangle this dark chapter of American history. The harm of Indian boarding schools is still felt today, and I will support every effort to rectify our tragic past. (5/5)

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: Native American children were sent hundreds of miles away from their homes to schools, including schools in Forest Grove and Salem. The government did this to disrupt family and community connections. (4/5)

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: The U.S. targeted Native American and Native Hawaiian youth in an attempt to strip their cultural identity and assimilate them. The children were put into manual labor and many were subjected to systemic abuse and corporal punishment.  (3/5)

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: From 1801, the U.S. operated 408 schools and at least 53 of them between 1819 and 1969 had burial grounds. Only 33 of those burial grounds were marked and @Interior expects to find more. (2/5)

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text:
The Department of the Interior has released part one of its Federal Indian Boarding School Initiative Investigative Report. What is detailed is both infuriating and heartbreaking. (1/5)
https://t.co/JZk6haSXa4

tweet_text: This news is distressing, but remember that abortion is still legal now so contact a health care provider if you need help. The House has already passed legislation to protect the right to safe, legal abortion, and I’m fighting for the Senate to take it up as soon as possible.

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: I remember the days before Roe v. Wade, and I know that banning abortion does not make it go away; it makes it unsafe and dangerous.

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: I also expect the Biden Administration will remain vigilant against threats to our security and will continue using all available diplomatic avenues to secure the rights and safety of those who remain in Afghanistan.

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: Additionally, I am committed to providing refugees with the support they need to rebuild their lives.

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: I have been working tirelessly with Oregonians to help their family members flee Afghanistan, and I will persist in doing all I can to make sure our Afghan allies and those most at risk under Taliban rule are able to leave the country safely.

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: I am grateful for the servicemembers who have dedicated themselves to protecting our nation and working to improve the lives of Afghans, particularly their heroic effort in recent days to assist more than 120,000 people in escaping the country.

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: The U.S. must do everything possible to avoid again becoming involved in a long, protracted war.

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: After 20 years, the U.S. has withdrawn its troops from Afghanistan. The withdrawal comes after decades of lives tragically lost, including the deaths of 13 servicemembers in the final days. We will always remember and honor their ultimate sacrifice.

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: I condemn the violence we have seen in Portland and across the country. Today I joined @SenJeffMerkley, @RonWyden, & @repblumenauer in calling on the @TheJusticeDept to investigate the interstate actions of domestic extremists, including the Proud Boys. https://t.co/dQMpKaBjvN

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: Withdrawing from Afghanistan is necessary, and doing so after 20 years was always going to be difficult. I have many questions about the process, but right now our focus needs to be the evacuation of US citizens, our Afghan allies, women who are at risk, and others.

tweet_text: Elections are the foundation of our democracy, and any effort to suppress the voice of the people at the ballot box is a threat to our country.

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: I will continue advocating for the priorities of our communities, and look forward to passing both the Build Back Better Plan and the Bipartisan Infrastructure Bill soon.

name: Suzanne Bonamici

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: Oregon stands ready to welcome refugees from Afghanistan, & I will work to get them the support they need. I'll also keep advocating for diplomatic efforts to protect the human rights of those who remain in Afghanistan—including women & girls—& to reduce violence and instability.

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: We can help more Afghans get to safety quickly and without unnecessary delays by accepting vetted refugees and expediting Special Immigrant Visas, Priority 2 visas, and humanitarian parole.

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: Now is the time to pass meaningful policies that will help in #SolvingTheClimateCrisis. By advancing @POTUS’s plan to #BuildBackBetter, we will transition to a clean energy economy, create good-paying jobs, and reduce emissions to protect our planet.

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: Leading scientists from around the world are sounding the alarm: it is not too late to avoid the worst effects of the #ClimateCrisis. Last year, @HouseDemocrats released a @ClimateCrisis Action Plan to reach net-zero emissions no later than mid-century & net-negative thereafter.

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: The #IPCCReport warns that if we do not take comprehensive action to cut carbon and methane emissions, we will likely exceed 1.5°C of warming a decade earlier than expected. This is the moment for bold action.

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: In NW Oregon, we are already experiencing the effects of the #ClimateCrisis, like unprecedented heat waves, ocean acidification, and raging wildfires. The #IPCCReport outlines that these climate crisis-driven extreme weather events are now widespread and increasing in frequency.

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: Today’s report from @IPCC_CH is the latest alarm demonstrating that the #ClimateCrisis is here and increasing in intensity because of human activity. The findings are dire, but we still have time to #ActOnClimate to avoid the worst consequences. https://t.co/Y7wmeIMEBY

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: Efforts to conserve #30x30 are a key piece of #SolvingTheClimateCrisis and are embedded in the natural based climate solutions section of our @ClimateCrisis Action Plan. The Administration’s report is the starting point and together we can conserve & restore #AmericaTheBeautiful

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: Conservation efforts must be collaborative and protections need to be decided with all stakeholders at the table. I’m grateful that the Admin is establishing an interagency working group to work with Tribes, forest owners, farmers, and fishery management councils to #Protect30x30

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: The commitment to #Protect30x30 is grounded in science. These efforts will slow the loss of nature, safeguard biodiversity, maintain healthy fisheries and wildlife populations, and prevent the collapse of the natural systems that stabilize our climate.

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: Today the Biden-Harris Admin outlined a bold vision for a locally led and voluntary nationwide goal to conserve 30% of U.S. lands and ocean by 2030. #30x30 is an opportunity to address the #ClimateCrisis, create good-paying jobs, and address inequitable access to the outdoors. https://t.co/4UYsI6UAwv

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: This bipartisan bill will expand coverage of NOAA’s sexual harassment prevention and response policy and provide a secure reporting structure and advocacy resources for survivors. https://t.co/CLwY5oG16G

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: The scientist eventually returned to her research. But she is not alone in her experience, and there are still gaps in NOAA’s efforts.

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: Several years ago, I spoke w/ a fisheries biologist who was forced to put her career on hold because of sexual harassment on a NOAA vessel. I worked w/ NOAA leadership to make tangible changes to the agency’s policies & procedures for reporting & investigating sexual harassment.

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: Scientists and researchers must be safe and feel safe at work, and not fear retaliation for reporting sexual harassment and assault. This starts with prevention and a meaningful way for survivors to seek justice.

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: The #AmericanRescuePlan increases the Child Tax Credit, and the benefits are already helping lift children and their families out of poverty. Congress must make these life-changing tax credit provisions permanent, and the extension in the #AmericanFamiliesPlan is a strong start.

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: As we have seen during the pandemic, #PaidLeave can be lifesaving for workers and their families. I’ve long called for a universal paid family and medical leave program, and I’m pleased the #AmericanFamiliesPlan will provide #PaidLeaveforAll to meet the needs of working families.

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: The #AmericanFamiliesPlan builds on that foundation by providing low and middle income families with direct support to help cover child care costs, along with making free preschool available to all children who are 3 and 4 years old.

name: Suzanne Bonamici
tweet_text: Quality child care was already hard to find and harder to afford, and the increased demands of the pandemic forced many mothers and caregivers to leave the workforce. I helped secure $39B for child care in the #AmericanRescuePlan.
